Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Knot2

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Knot2
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Knot2>
public class Knot2 extends Object implements Comparable<Knot2>
Organizes the vectors that shape a cubic BÃ©zier curve into a coordinate (or anchor point), fore handle (the following control point) and rear handle (the preceding control point).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Knot2.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of knot easing functions.
    static class 
    Knot2.Lerp
    A functional class to ease between two knots with linear interpolation.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final Vec2
    coord
    The spatial coordinate of the knot.
    final Vec2
    foreHandle
    The handle that warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.
    final Vec2
    rearHandle
    The handle that warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

    hashCode()
     
    Knot2
    mirrorHandles()
    Mirrors this knot's handles.
    Knot2
    mirrorHandlesBackward()
    Sets the fore handle to mirror the rear handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
    Knot2
    mirrorHandlesForward()
    Sets the rear handle to mirror the fore handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.

    • Knot2

      public Knot2(float xCoord, float yCoord, float xFore, float yFore)
      Creates a knot from a coordinates and fore handle. The rear handle is a mirror of the fore handle.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - the x coordinate
      yCoord - the y coordinate
      xFore - the fore handle x
      yFore - the fore handle y

    • fromSegCatmull

      public static Knot2 fromSegCatmull(float xPrevAnchor, float yPrevAnchor, float xCurrAnchor, float yCurrAnchor, float xNextAnchor, float yNextAnchor, float xAdvAnchor, float yAdvAnchor, float tightness, Knot2 prev, Knot2 next)
      Sets two knots from a segment of a Catmull-Rom curve. Assumes that the previous knot's coordinate is set to a prior anchor point.

      The previous knot's fore handle, the next knot's rear handle and the next knot's coordinate are set by this function.
      Parameters:
      xPrevAnchor - the previous anchor x
      yPrevAnchor - the previous anchor y
      xCurrAnchor - the current anchor x
      yCurrAnchor - the current anchor y
      xNextAnchor - the next anchor x
      yNextAnchor - the next anchor y
      xAdvAnchor - the advance anchor x
      yAdvAnchor - the advance anchor y
      tightness - the curve tightness
      prev - the previous knot
      next - the next knot
      Returns:
      the next knot

    • fromSegCatmull

      public static Knot2 fromSegCatmull(Vec2 prevAnchor, Vec2 currAnchor, Vec2 nextAnchor, Vec2 advAnchor, float tightness, Knot2 prev, Knot2 next)
      Sets two knots from a segment of a Catmull-Rom curve. The default curve tightness is 0.0.

      Assumes that the previous knot's coordinate is set to a prior anchor point. The previous knot's fore handle, the next knot's rear handle and the next knot's coordinate are set by this function.
      Parameters:
      prevAnchor - the previous anchor
      currAnchor - the current anchor
      nextAnchor - the next anchor
      advAnchor - the advance anchor
      tightness - the curve tightness
      prev - the previous knot
      next - the next knot
      Returns:
      the next knot

    • fromSegCubic

      public static Knot2 fromSegCubic(float xPrevControl, float yPrevControl, float xNextControl, float yNextControl, float xNextAnchor, float yNextAnchor, Knot2 prev, Knot2 next)
      Sets two knots from a segment of a cubic curve.

      Assumes that the previous knot's coordinate is set to the first anchor point. The previous knot's fore handle, the next knot's rear handle and the next knot's coordinate are set by this function.
      Parameters:
      xPrevControl - the previous control point x
      yPrevControl - the previous control point y
      xNextControl - the next control point x
      yNextControl - the next control point y
      xNextAnchor - the next anchor x
      yNextAnchor - the next anchor y
      prev - the previous knot
      next - the next knot
      Returns:
      the next knot

    • rotateZ

      public Knot2 rotateZ(float cosa, float sina)
      Rotates this knot around the z axis. Accepts calculated sine and cosine of an angle, so that collections of knots can be efficiently rotated without repeatedly calling cos and sin.
      Parameters:
      cosa - cosine of the angle
      sina - sine of the angle
      Returns:
      this knot
      See Also:
      • Vec2.rotateZ(Vec2, float, float, Vec2)

    • set

      public Knot2 set(float xCoord, float yCoord, float xFore, float yFore)
      Sets the knot's coordinate and fore handle. The rear handle is a mirror of the fore handle.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - the x coordinate
      yCoord - the y coordinate
      xFore - the fore handle x
      yFore - the fore handle y
      Returns:
      the knot
